intro: Pseudoboivinella laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian pseudoboivinella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
